text.0: reposing on the rivers wave the sage hath widely flowed around.
text.1: bearing the hymn which many love.
text.2: when the five kindred companies active in duty with the song.
text.4: then in his juice whose strength is great have all the gods rejoiced themselves.
text.5: when he hath clothed him in the milk.
text.6: freeing himself he flows away leaving his bodys severed limbs.
text.7: and meets his own companion here.
text.8: he by the daughters of the priest like a fair youth hath been adorned.
text.9: making the milk as twere his robe.
text.10: oer the fine fingers through desire of milk in winding course he goes.
text.11: and utters voice which he hath found.
text.12: the nimble fingers have approached adorning him the lord of strength.
text.13: they grasp the vigorous coursers back.
text.14: comprising all the treasures that are in the heavens and on the earth.
text.15: come soma as our faithful friend.
